content:
What recommendations would you give to someone considering Zulip?

For more context, please see #zulip > softwarereviews.com
I would recommend joining https://chat.zulip.org and start experiencing Zulip. Use the #feedback channel.
I would suggest trying the desktop, web, and mobile apps.
I would suggest poking around in https://github.com/zulip/zulip , especially the issue tracker.

There are a couple podcasts I like about Zulip.

  • https://www.pythonpodcast.com/episodepage/zulip-chat-with-tim-abbott-episode-118 is from 2017 so it's a bit dated but it's a nice technical deep dive into Zulip with it's founder, Tim Abbott
  • https://changelog.com/podcast/607 is much more recent, only a couple months ago, and covers Zulip at a high level with Alya Abbott.

There's a new onboarding video for new users that's being worked on in https://github.com/zulip/zulip/pull/32074

It's short and worth watching. For now, you can click "raw" to download it.
